page.title: 10TRADE
page.content: There used to be several shops in the village. When the last one, which was also the post office, closed some years ago, the village took over the church institute, built in 1880, which was then a builder's store. In 1980 it was re-opened as the Quarry Centre. The Quarry Centre opens every Tuesday as a Post Office and shop with sweets, plants, home made produce and vegetables. The Quarry Centre won the National Village Ventures Award for 1982-3. Mrs Macey is the sub-postmistress. Other ladies take turns to run the produce stall and sweet counter. On Mondays and Fridays Doctor Hugo and Doctor Johnson hold their surgeries in a room in the Centre. A quilting group use the Quarry Centre on some mornings making quilts for village charities.
